title: Mourning the death of Dr. Annette M. Saturnelli, distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION mourning the death of Dr. Annette M. Saturnelli,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Annette Saturnelli of Newburgh, New York, died on Monday,
December 20, 2010, at the age of 73; and
  WHEREAS, Superintendent of the Newburgh Enlarged City School District,
Dr. Annette Saturnelli gave countless hours to further  the  vision  she
had for public education; and
  WHEREAS,  Before her appointment as Superintendent, Dr. Annette Satur-
nelli served in the following positions in the District:  Acting  Super-
intendent,   Deputy   Superintendent,   Executive  Director  for  Funded
Programs, and Director of Science  Pre-K-12;  prior  to  coming  to  the
Newburgh  Enlarged City School District, she was on the staff of the New
York State Education Department's Bureau of Science Education where  she
was  responsible  for the Chemistry, Elementary and middle level Science
Education Programs for New York State; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Annette Saturnelli has been  a  teacher  of  Science  for
K-12,  and  an  adjunct  professor at several colleges and universities;
prior to her career as an educator, she was a  research  biochemist  for
five  years  at  American  Cyanamid's  Lederle  Laboratories  where  her
published research focused on the tetracycline antibiotics; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Annette Saturnelli earned degrees  from  Vassar  College,
SUNY  New  Paltz and New York University; she is a past-president of the
New York State Science Supervisor's Association and the  Science  Teach-
er's  Association  of New York State where she led both organizations in
the development of their strategic plans; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Annette Saturnelli has authored numerous books and  arti-
cles and has received numerous awards for administration and teaching at
the  state and national levels; she has also received community recogni-
tions such as the Pillars of the  Community  Award,  the  Orange  County
Women of Achievement Award, the NAACP Educator's Award and Mother of the
Year from the Newburgh Elks Club; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Annette Saturnelli distinguished herself in her profes-
sion and by her sincere dedication and substantial contribution  to  the
welfare of her community; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Annette Saturnelli' s commitment to excellence, and her
spirit of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise,  includ-
ing charitable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Predeceased by her granddaughter Carly, and her sister-in-law
Maria,  Dr.  Annette  Saturnelli  is survived by her husband, Carlo; her
children, Carla,  Steven,  Anne  and  husband,  Philip,  and  Karen  and
husband,  William;  her  grandchildren,  Dominic, Danielle and Alex; her
brother, Joseph and his wife, Judy; her nephews, Joseph  and  his  wife,
Lisa,  David  and  his  wife,  Ann;  as well as her niece, Diane and her
husband, Tom; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion,  and  comforted  by  a loving family, Dr. Annette Saturnelli
leaves behind a legacy which will long endure the passage  of  time  and
will  remain  as  a  comforting memory to all she served and befriended;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn  the death of Dr. Annette M. Saturnelli, distinguished citizen and
devoted member of her community; and be it further

  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Dr. Annette M. Saturnelli.
